item.description:
This is a local documentary about prison inmates who train dogs for the handicapped. Ahh!, so its a doc about something good being done! The director and some of the stars will be present, although I can not vouch for the dogs. I admit that I have a penchant for the "smaller" documentaries and I like dogs.

Heres is the capsule from the MFA:

Prison Pups by Alice Dungan Bouverie (2006, 58 min.) follows four inmates as they raise and train service dogs for the handicapped and hearing impaired. At Concord Farm, a minimum security facility in Massachusetts, these inmates learn to take on the responsibility of caring for a puppy and find in themselves, a capacity for nurturing and affection. The empowerment they experience in their role as trainers is profound. Discussion with director and stars follows screening.

Cost is $9 and please note that this film is only 58 minutes in length. The film starts at 2:40.

After the film, I will be holding a Meetup sign near the front row and then we will go to a local cafe.
item.name: Woof! Dogs Trained by Prison Inmates for the Handicapped
